poem:
**A Country Unbuttoned**

Germany decides against the march,  
a morning without boots echoing on cobblestones,  
young men waiting for the sound  
of nothing but birdsong and bicycles,  
a whisper of uniforms folded in drawers.  
Instead, they dream of fields,  
where choice blooms like wildflowers,  
quietly waving their bright volunteer faces.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. Under the plan intended to revamp the country’s depleted military, young German men will have to indicate their readiness to serve and undergo a medical from next year. There will be financial and other incentives to encourage voluntary recruitment, but if that fails". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long.
